Thank you,Nicolette From: Nicolette Taylor Sent: Friday, August 30, 2013 3:05 PM To: 'Kathia Juste' Cc: Jay Benedicto; Wole Ikotun Subject: RE: MBO Requested Changes Hi Kathia, I received feedback from my contracts team regarding this item and their response to me was the following. MBO is not comfortable with leaving this clause in the agreement. The Contractor in this case is Acentia since you have the contract with the Federal Contracting Officer. Our Contract is with you (Acentia) and the flow down of this to MBO is unfair since we are not agreeing to nor do we have control over what Acentia has agreed to deliver to your client. Wole will deliver what Acentia tells him to, but the flow down of this FAR to us should not be required. MBO is a sub to Acentia and we believe you can remove the flow down and take the risk. At a minimum we should be able to see the contract Acentia has with the Feds and Wole should review to make sure he feels comfortable that it can be delivered. Please let me know if you have any questions about this and I would be happy to speak with you. Thank you and have a great weekend,Nicolette From: Kathia Juste [mailto:Kathia.Juste@acentia.com <mailto:Kathia.Juste@acentia.com>] Sent: Wednesday, August 28, 2013 4:57 PM To: Nicolette Taylor Cc: Jay Benedicto; Wole Ikotun Subject: RE: MBO Requested Changes Hi Nicolette, Sure, the clause is located in FAR section 52.242-1: https://acquisition.gov/far/current/html/52_241_244.html#wp1128780 <https://acquisition.gov/far/current/html/52_241_244.html#wp1128780> Best regards, Kathia JusteContracts AdministratorOffice: (703) 712-4160 kathia.juste@acentia.com <mailto:kathia.juste@acentia.com><image001.jpg> From: Nicolette Taylor [mailto:ntaylor@mbopartners.com <mailto:ntaylor@mbopartners.com>] Sent: Wednesday, August 28, 2013 4:48 PM To: Kathia Juste Cc: Jay Benedicto; Wole Ikotun Subject: RE: MBO Requested Changes Hi Kathia, What are the parameters around the government being able to ask for the funds back? Thank you,Nicolette From: Kathia Juste [mailto:Kathia.Juste@acentia.com <mailto:Kathia.Juste@acentia.com>] Sent: Wednesday, August 28, 2013 3:14 PM To: Nicolette Taylor Cc: Jay Benedicto; Wole Ikotun Subject: RE: MBO Requested Changes Hi Nicolette, We’ve reviewed the suggested language, however, we still cannot accept this change. Best regards, Kathia JusteContracts AdministratorOffice: (703) 712-4160 kathia.juste@acentia.com <mailto:kathia.juste@acentia.com><image001.jpg> From: Nicolette Taylor [mailto:ntaylor@mbopartners.com <mailto:ntaylor@mbopartners.com>] Sent: Tuesday, August 27, 2013 3:58 PM To: Kathia Juste Cc: Jay Benedicto; Wole Ikotun Subject: RE: MBO Requested Changes Hi Kathia, I heard back from my contracts team and first of all, thank you for the changes that you have accepted. I wanted to have a quick conversation with you about the changes requested that you have notated that you cannot accept as we are willing to leave 10b and 18a7 as is, but for section 6d (Disallowance of Payments) we cannot leave as is. We could accept adjusting the language to say (see bolded section): Disallowance of Payments: If Company is required, because of any action of the Customer for which the Task Order is issued, to refund or credit to the Customer any amount with respect to an item of cost for which Company had reimbursed the Subcontractor, the[NT1] <#_msocom_1> Subcontractor shall, use it’s best efforts to recover the funds from Subcontractor’s employee the amounts requested. If Subcontractor is able to recover the funds, Subcontractor will promptly repay to Company the disapproved amount[NT2] <#_msocom_2> The reason we are unable to promptly repay upon demand is because we will pay Wole once we receive payment from you, so the funds are not with MBO at that point. We can say that we will use our best efforts to recover the funds and if we are able to get them back from Wole then we will return them to you. Please let me know if you would like to discuss this in further detail.
